snippet: Six months after Hurricane Sandy, IceStone, a Brooklyn factory specializing in making hard surfaces like tables, is back in operation because its employees made what had seemed impossible possible.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes that six months after Hurricane Sandy, IceStone,  Brooklyn factory specializing in making hard surfaces like tables, is back in operation because its employees did the work of expensive contractors, cutting a $2 million to $3 million renovation down to less than $1 million.
lead_paragraph: Six months after Hurricane Sandy, IceStone, a Brooklyn factory specializing in making hard surfaces like tables, is back in operation because its employees made what had seemed impossible possible.

headline.seo: Empowered Workers Help Revive a Brooklyn Factory Hit by Hurricane
headline.main: Flooded Factory Is Brought Back by Its Workers
headline.print_headline: Flooded Factory Is Brought Back By Its Workers
